title: What kind of music is 'Elevator music'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Elevator music is an umbrella term for any type of instrumental music that is played in the background of places where people congregate for purposes other than listening to music. Orchestras or string ensembles (such as the Mantovani Orchestra) covering light popular or classical selections were common. Kenny G’s hit records have been termed “elevator music,” as has much of what played on smooth jazz radio stations in the 1990s.

The equivalent would be whatever you hear when you're put on hold when calling a government agency such as the DMV. Around the time people started noticing how bad it generally was, the Blues Brothers film riffed on it.
Normally Bossa Nova is the standard cliché, the cornerstone of muzak, like this: Bossa Nova Elevator Muzak
